aboutMe.name: Cyprien
aboutMe.title: Software Engineer
aboutMe.description: I recently graduated from IMT Mines Ales as an Artificial Intelligence Engineer. I'm passionate about working with data and developing tools that are linked to machine learning. I also enjoy designing data-driven visualizations and user experiences on the web.

education.title: Software Engineer
education.description: Master's Degree in Engineering, specialized in Computer Science with a focus on Artificial Intelligence.

education.title: CPGE (MPSI/MP)
education.description: Two-year undergraduate intensive course in mathematics and physics.

experience.title: Gap year
experience.description:
Took a little more than a year off to travel, reconnect with friends and family and work on many personal projects.
The projects relevant in this context are:
 - Built a fully custom parametric 3D model and a web-based pipeline that generates the architectural drawings of my future house (depends only on OpenIFC and Blender)
 - Ported OpenCascade to the Zig build system and developed a simple JS-based, scripted CAD program for personal use (OCCT is the only dependency)
 - Built a CNC machine

experience.title: Data Scientist
experience.description:
Working as a "full-stack data scientist" at D3S, a small consulting company specializing in ML-enhanced industrial manufacturing cost prediction.
My tasks included:
 - Backend development in Python, implementing business requirements in a maintainable way
 - Frontend development in JS & TS with React, delivering new features quickly while improving code quality & reducing the number of dependencies
 - Managing a team of 2-4 developers, for customer and internal projects 
- Reviewing & merging contributions 
- Taking software architecture decisions on assigned projects & assisting the tech lead 
- CI/CD pipeline creation & maintenance 
- Internal IT infrastructure maintenance

experience.title: Final Year Internship
experience.description: Worked on data-driven modeling and system-identification out of data. Implemented state-of-the-art system identification models in Python. Deployed a POC service to identify dynamics from data with Flask.

experience.title: Research Internship
experience.description: Worked on generating obfuscation and minification rules using machine learning. Investigated methodologies for estimating the likelyhood of parts of code to be vulnerable to obfuscation. Wrote an article (see publications).

experience.title: Field Mission
experience.description: Audited the company for the security of the employees. Updated the internal company welcome booklet.

experience.title: Field Mission
experience.description: Studied the market for the creation of a specialized hotel for academics.

skills.title: Python
skills.description: Proficient in Python (5+ years of experience), its popular data-science libraries as well as some experience with the C API.

skills.title: JavaScript/HTML/CSS
skills.description: Proficient in JavaScript/CSS/HTML (2+ years of experience). Solid knowledge of React and Redux. Passionate about web-based data experiences powered by D3.js.

blogposts.title: Neural Highlighting
blogposts.description: Implementing a syntax highlighting system only using neural networks.

blogposts.title: Binary MNIST
blogposts.description: Simplest ML problem solved with TFJS, a home-made dataset and visualized with D3.

blogposts.title: SINDy: autonomous systems and explicit time-dependency
blogposts.description: Visualizing the differences between the identification of autonomous and time-dependent dynamics in COVID trajectories.

blogposts.title: SINDy: non-polynomial candidate functions
blogposts.description: Plotting the difference in fitting data with the SINDy algorithm with rational basis functions.

blogposts.title: SINDy: data-driven COVID modeling
blogposts.description: Using system-identification algorithms to explore the dynamics in COVID-related data.

publications.title: Vision : Alleviating Android Developer Burden on Obfuscation.
publications.description: A study of the obfuscation/minification usage in the open-source Android developement apps. A crowd-sourcing technique based on ML is proposed to help developers write more effective obfuscation and minification rules.

publications.title: Modélisation incertaine à partir de mesures non-reproductibles. Application à la comparaison de pression exercée par des matelas.
publications.description: Uncertain modeling of low-quality data from non-reproducible experiments. The goal is to allow uncertain hypothesis testing for unreliable data. The proposed techniques are applied to real-world clinical data of a comparison of two mattresses.

publications.title: Data-driven COVID modeling.
publications.description: Report about my final internship at the chair of Applied Analysis at the Friedrich Alexander University in Erlangen under the supervision of Prof. Enrique Zuazua. We used system identification techniques in order to study the dynamics of COVID-related data.
